website_summaries.verdict: Make abstract fraction and decimal concepts more concrete with these colorful math manipulatives.
pros: Colorful, stackable blocks with fraction and decimal markings
cons: Printing may wear off over time

customer_reviews.title: Seems like the numbers should have been printed the other way ...
customer_reviews.text: Seems like the numbers should have been printed the other way feels like they r upside down. Like when u stack a lego u usually put the bumpy side up! But if u put bumpy side up the numbers would b upside down! So u have to put bumpy side down and then they fall over. They r a good tool just annoying they wont stand up.
customer_reviews.author: Yomomma

customer_reviews.title: Fabulous tool for hands-on learning of fractions!
customer_reviews.text: Great product for helping elementary and middle school students understand fractions, decimals, and percents. Especially good for helping understanding of the relation between multiple fractions (1/3 and 2/6 for example). Great for kids who are hands-on or visual learners. I used it recently with my sixth grade students in a lesson on adding fractions with different denominators and it really helped them to be able to see the relative sizes of the fractions. Great tool. My one complaint is that the set doesn’t come with a base. Since the blocks are all interlocking ;kind of like LEGO’s) it would really help if there was a base that you could put different towers into so you could easily compare the heights.
customer_reviews.author: AnnieR

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: Great design, sturdiness, and useful multiple marking types. Also wide age appropriateness: my 3 year old plays w it like legos, my 4 year old and I pretend to share a “chocolate bar” fairly amongst her stuffed animals at “tea”, and my 6 year old attempts to read the markings and figure out how it works. Absolutely wonderful educational toy.
customer_reviews.author: CDLH Linde

customer_reviews.title: Loved these! Would only make one addition.
customer_reviews.text: Am happy I picked these up when they briefly were on sale on Prime Day. These are great! A perfect visual and tactile representation of fractions and decimals - easy to compare with each other and get a better grasp on a too-often difficult to understand concept. The only thing I would add to the 1 column: 1 represented as a fraction (1/1). This is important so students understand that even whole numbers can be written in fraction form for when they move into mixed numbers and further, into making whole numbers into fractions to solve more complicated arithmetic. Not a deal breaker though! Easy enough just to write it on there with a sharpie. Would definitely purchase again.
customer_reviews.author: Lolaloo

customer_reviews.title: great teaching tool
customer_reviews.text: i don't home school and i am not a teacher, that being said i can't tell you how many times we have grabbed these during a teaching moment for my 5 year old. they are well constructed, snap together easily (although the 1/12th blocks are a bit hard for him to pull apart) and the printed numbers do not wear off. he is even getting them when he comes across a fraction problem or even when he measures things when we bake. defiantly a good thing to have on hand. i know someone mentioned they were only printed on one side...ours do not have that problem.
customer_reviews.author: terabma

customer_reviews.title: These are great because not only do they have the fractions for ...
customer_reviews.text: Just got them so haven't used them yet, but had similar ones for my oldest daughter and misplaced them. Bought these for my youngest daughter. These are great because not only do they have the fractions for each piece, but each one also has the corresponding decimal number. Will be a huge help to let my daughter see, manipulate, and truly understand how fractions compare with one another.
customer_reviews.author: LisaP

customer_reviews.title: Teacher requested for classroom
customer_reviews.text: This Learning Resources Fraction Tower Activity Set was purchased as a donation to be used in our grandson's classroom. His teacher picked out a few items she wanted, and this Math manipulative set was one of them. They are very sturdy, and the kids enjoy using them. They visually help students learn the concept of fractions.
customer_reviews.author: Tomcat 79er

customer_reviews.title: Great assisted learning tool.
customer_reviews.text: Great for kids learning fractions but only useful if your child is wanting to do a bit of additional learning at home. The cubes aren't exciting but definately will grow with your child since it gives the value in 3 different ways. My child is in grade 1 and I happen to buy it just before they learned fractions so my child was interested in looking at them and has helped her ace her class work and test. It has since been set aside and I guess will come out again next school year. I have also purchased the circles because they also learn fractions in pie shape.
customer_reviews.author: OnlineShopper

customer_reviews.title: Visual and hands on learning
customer_reviews.text: I had used this set successfully in my classroom, so when I began tutoring, I knew this would make a valuable tool to help my student. I bought my own set. They are sturdy and have multiple applications.
customer_reviews.author: william e young

customer_reviews.title: Good for illustrating middle school math
customer_reviews.text: I love these SO much. They have been such a great help for working through seventh and eighth grade math with my kids. It is so helpful to be able to instantly show converting percents to fractions to decimals.
customer_reviews.author: Lalibela

customer_reviews.title: These are perfect for all kids but as homeschoolers we needed something ...
customer_reviews.text: These are perfect for all kids but as homeschoolers we needed something that was easy to keep up with and would keep their attention. These are very easy to use and snap together well. My 7 and 9 year old are able to easily read and learn from them. I would highly recommend them.
customer_reviews.author: Nikki C

customer_reviews.title: Great intro to fractions
customer_reviews.text: Such a fun idea to introduce fractions! My drawing skills are mediocre so I really needed to find something to show each fraction. And bonus they’re fun to play with and stack!
customer_reviews.author: Niki

customer_reviews.title: Your kid learning fractions, decimals, and percentages - needs this!
customer_reviews.text: This is such a wonderful visual tool / math manipulative for kids learning about fractions, decimals, and percentages and how they related to each other
customer_reviews.author: Miss Lou

customer_reviews.title: Great Teaching Tool
customer_reviews.text: I bought this manipulative to help 4th and 5th graders better understand the concepts of, and interrelationships between, fractions, decimals, and percentages. It has been especially beneficial for struggling students, especially those that are visual learners. It has really helped my students to develop a much clearer understanding of these concepts. Another reviewer commented that they were very disappointed because the pieces were not labeled on all sides. That customer must have received a faulty product. The Equivalency Cubes I received are clearly labeled on 3 sides: one side has the fraction, one has the decimal, and one has the percentage. Great purchase!
customer_reviews.author: K & S

customer_reviews.title: EXCELLENT teaching tool
customer_reviews.text: Just used this with 3 girls today for a tutoring session to help them learn equivalent fractions. They were a hit! Easily come apart and go back together! T
customer_reviews.author: Love4thewin

customer_reviews.title: Wish these were around years ago
customer_reviews.text: These cubes are awesome. It is a great visual for fractions and a great way to teach kids that a number can be equal even though it's presented a different way.
customer_reviews.author: Elle

customer_reviews.title: Awesome fraction help
customer_reviews.text: Pairs well with the fraction circles. Definitely buy them together. These are nice because they also have the decimals and percentages.
customer_reviews.author: Arc

customer_reviews.title: High quality
customer_reviews.text: I love these! As we move into fractions for school this year, I’m expecting some struggles. However, i believes this will help tremendously! And the quality is great! Definitely a good purchase
customer_reviews.author: A Lewis

customer_reviews.title: Very helpful for 4th grade math!
customer_reviews.text: Great product!! I bought these for my 4th grader to understand fractions. Its great becuase it has fractions on one side, decimals on another and percents on another side. They really helped and his tutor liked them so much she ordered herself a set. Highly recomend
customer_reviews.author: amanda burke

customer_reviews.title: Great Fraction Set
customer_reviews.text: I rated Learning Resources Fraction Tower Activity set 5 stars because it is a great Fraction Tower. It is built well and will last even after my child gets through with it. I was debating whether to purchase this or the flat fraction tiles tray. I am pleased I chose this one since most workbooks offer fractions that you can optionally cut out and use the same way but with this Fraction Tower you are given more possibility and greater understanding of fractions. Overall, this is a great teaching tool to have as your child learns his/her fractions.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon_Consumer

customer_reviews.title: Makes sense of decimals and fractions for everybody
customer_reviews.text: I teach adults, mostly. It's amazing how many people have never grasped the concept of equivalent fractions. I used to explain and draw pictures of pies until my fingers and lips were blue. I found a dusty set of these in the back of a cabinet, pulled them out, and voila! The ideas that used to take several sessions to get across to my students can be distilled into about half an hour of working with these cubes. My students RAVE! Given the cost of textbooks, these cubes are a bargain and I bought a set for myself.
customer_reviews.author: Jody

customer_reviews.title: The product works well for comparing percent and decimals and ...
customer_reviews.text: The product works well for comparing percent and decimals and fractions. The only drawback was the package it comes in does not work to store the product in long term. It is vital to teaching to have all the parts together so one will need to find a storage container. We used a ziplock baggie which is sufficient, just not convenient.
customer_reviews.author: Classy Mamma

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for my 5th grader
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for my 5th grader. I like that it has fractions, decimals, and percentages. The fives were printed upside down, but they still do the job.
customer_reviews.author: CorrieL

customer_reviews.title: Helps the visual, hands on learner master these skills
customer_reviews.text: My son uses these during his tutoring sessions and with his homework. He is a visual, hands on learner and this has helped him master the different fractions and percentages.
customer_reviews.author: T. Taylor

customer_reviews.title: How many sixths are equal to two-thirds?
customer_reviews.text: This is a great teaching aid for children just learning about fractions or having difficulty with adding/subtracting/comparing fractions. One side of each cube shows the fraction (1⁄4), another shows the decimal fraction (.25) and a third side shows the percentage (25%). I am a tutor, and sometimes lose one to a student who wants to keep it to use for practice or schoolwork. Then I buy another to keep in my tutoring kit.
customer_reviews.author: Barbara Fisher

customer_reviews.title: Why didn't I think of these?!?!
customer_reviews.text: Our package arrived today, and these blocks are wonderful. It seems as though being able to visualize and manipulate these blocks are helping my son to grasp the concepts of percentage and fractions. We would definitely recommend these to any child who is struggling.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa Bruner

customer_reviews.title: Great teaching tool
customer_reviews.text: This is a wonderful tool which I'll be using to teach decimals and so far it kids have been using it on their own. I think being able to see the relative size of the proportions is a wonderful and the size of these pieces are large enough and well-made.
customer_reviews.author: NYC Shopper

customer_reviews.title: Great way to help dialogue with your kids (even young ones!) about number concepts
customer_reviews.text: Excellent toy! My 4-year old was just beginning to show interest in how numbers break down and what percentages are, and she enjoys playing with the pieces and stacking them together, and I can use them to demonstrate visually why 50% is less than 75% and so on. I realize these are probably meant for a slightly older audience but she seemed to find value in seeing how a unit can can be split even at that age.
customer_reviews.author: Julia G.P.

customer_reviews.title: Great Tool for Homeschool
customer_reviews.text: Enjoy these blocks and how they snap together like Legos. They help me to make concepts easier to understand for our 9 year old daughter.
customer_reviews.author: E. Smith

customer_reviews.title: They are a great visual and have really helped him
customer_reviews.text: I've found these very helpful for my 4th grade son, whom uses them while at home and working on homework. They are a great visual and have really helped him.
customer_reviews.author: SJL

customer_reviews.title: Good product for the money
customer_reviews.text: Used these to teach our kids math values (decimal & fraction). Easy to understand when you play with it.
customer_reviews.author: Sonia Van Laar

customer_reviews.title: perfectly described
customer_reviews.text: My kids loved this and found it fun to learn and easy to understand
customer_reviews.author: John David Hungarland

customer_reviews.title: Interlocking fraction tubes excellent to teach equivalent fractions.
customer_reviews.text: These fraction towers sure are handy. The set is composed of interlocking hollow pieces like the cubes kinder kids use to learn to count. Students can lock different fractions together and compare them side by side to understand equivalent fractions.
customer_reviews.author: CG

customer_reviews.title: Extremely useful
customer_reviews.text: We homeschool, and my youngest daughter absolutely loves math, so I'm always trying to find her fun manipulatives. We have stackable "hamburger" fraction pieces, but it was sometimes hard to get my kids to understand the relationship between fractions, percentages, and decimals. This makes that a non-issue. Plus they have fun building with them.
customer_reviews.author: Jerritt C. Dayhoff

customer_reviews.title: but I think this visual representation of fractions is a great way to learn than having to imagine what 1/10 ...
customer_reviews.text: I have a foundation and some teachers I showed this to wanted to have this for their class. I had hoped it was bigger so you can show it in front of the class and everyone can see it from the back of the room, but I think this visual representation of fractions is a great way to learn than having to imagine what 1/10 looks like in your head.
customer_reviews.author: Don D.

customer_reviews.title: Great for tactile kids
customer_reviews.text: My childvis tactile and visual. Manipulating objects when working on math helps him understand concepts better. These have helped him quickly understand fraction and decimal concepts and make math "less boring."
customer_reviews.author: Ms. Jaeger

customer_reviews.title: Great to introduce fractions, or to help kids struggling with them
customer_reviews.text: My kids and my tutoring students love playing with these. They really solidify the idea of fractions (better than drawing a sliced up pizza!). Being able to stack equivalent fractions next to each other and compare the height is a game changer for kids having trouble with the concept of fractions.
customer_reviews.author: BeautyBuffetClub

customer_reviews.title: Get a good price
customer_reviews.text: The product is what it claims to be. My daughter enjoys playing with them, so they're doing their job. The only thing I wish is that the clutch power between the fractional bits was a bit more consistent. Most bricks hold onto each other, but a few are a little subpar. For $10 this product is good. For $20 it's marginal.
customer_reviews.author: Peter Sipes

customer_reviews.title: Fraction, decimal & percents
customer_reviews.text: I like every this set bc it has the fraction, percent, and decimal equivalents. Helpful visualization and fun to play with.
customer_reviews.author: ellis bell

customer_reviews.title: Great for middle or high school students
customer_reviews.text: Loved the quality but found these to be too complex and therefore not very appealing to my 9 year old student. Gave them to my administrator friend at a local school for struggling middle and high school girls. They seem to work great for the older students.
customer_reviews.author: Lauren

customer_reviews.title: Great Tool
customer_reviews.text: These are a fantastic tool to help kids understand fractions as well as decimal equivalents. Love it. Wish I could afford to buy one for every kid in my granddaughter's class.
customer_reviews.author: SunnyB

customer_reviews.title: Buy it
customer_reviews.text: I only wish I'd found them sooner. This is a great visual resource for teaching kids fractions, decimals, and percentages. I highly recommend them.
customer_reviews.author: SS

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: Teaches fractions, decimals, and percentages in an easy to understand format. Great hands on math manipulative for teachers and homeschoolers alike. They snap together nicely and hold together well. May be difficult for younger accelerated students to manipulate. They are intended for ages 8+.
customer_reviews.author: SweetMom100

customer_reviews.title: This has helped my girls LEAPFROG a year ahead in math in 2 months
customer_reviews.text: My third Grader has already finished the fractions percents, etc. section in her math book for the year, and they haven't even gotten to that part yet! My 6th grader, when she gets stuck on her homework about percents, uses these to visualize the math problem, which REALLY helps her out.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: The numbers wear off.
customer_reviews.text: They were great for awhile. But after only limited use, the numbers have begun to rub off on a number of pieces.
customer_reviews.author: S Johnson

customer_reviews.title: math %
customer_reviews.text: great teaching tool I used it with my 5th grade grandson.
customer_reviews.author: ladylung

customer_reviews.title: Good
customer_reviews.text: I like these. They are great for kids learning fractions. Only thing is they are all printed upside down on the blocks
customer_reviews.author: Pfarino

customer_reviews.title: Good for 2nd through 4th graders.
customer_reviews.text: The children liked it as it was their only educational toy, and it was something they could use next week when they go back to school.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great visual/hands on learning
customer_reviews.text: I think these are great. I homeschool and am always looking for new things to keep the kids interested in learning. These are hands on and make explaining much easier if your child needs visual or touch to learn.
customer_reviews.author: Lin P

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Working with children can be challenging. This helps to teach them while they "think" they are playing.
customer_reviews.author: DebraD

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for learning
customer_reviews.text: My child has dyslexia and ADHD and these helps tremendously.
customer_reviews.author: Jsdavidson0407

customer_reviews.title: Good buy.
customer_reviews.text: Very good product. I bought two for my 3rd grader and he will likely use in 4th grade as well. I work at an ES and the teachers use similar blocks for visual.
customer_reviews.author: Alli A.H.

customer_reviews.title: Excellent math learning tool!
customer_reviews.text: These blocks helped make new work with fractions a breeze! I love that decimals & percents are also included. Used these with fourth graders at first, but finding them still helpful in 5th grade math too.
customer_reviews.author: L Moody

customer_reviews.title: Fun and educational
customer_reviews.text: We bought these for homeschooling but even when we aren't doing schoolwork, the kids like playing with them!
customer_reviews.author: **Top Secret**

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: is totally great! Its a easy way to help a child understand fractions!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great math manipulative
customer_reviews.text: Great math manipulative - fractions,decimal, percentage equivalents all in one, so comparisons are obvious and easy.
customer_reviews.author: Lauren Z.

customer_reviews.title: Great Tool for Students Struggling with Fractions/Decimals/Percents Equivalencies
customer_reviews.text: I love all the equivalencies on these tiles. Going from fractions to decimals to percents is a difficult skill to master and these help.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Just what I wanted!
customer_reviews.text: The package was easy to open, the pieces are printed on 3 sides (fractions, decimals, percents), and the multicolored pieces are easy to pull apart and put together. I teach 4th grade, and have several students who just don't understand equivalent fractions. This is a fantastic visual representation, and I think it'll help a lot. I will use them with my small groups... so I guess I'll need to buy a few more packages! I highly recommend these.
customer_reviews.author: K. Zainea

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Delivered Fast. Helps students understand visually the meaning of fractions
customer_reviews.author: Happyhomaker

customer_reviews.title: Visual Miracle
customer_reviews.text: When teaching fractions, decimals, and percentages, these manipulatives provide a colorful aid for students to immediately conceptualize what they are studying. Every student should have a set similar to this.
customer_reviews.author: Merle N. Savedow

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: I use these with my special needs students. They work well.
customer_reviews.author: spittman

customer_reviews.title: Math Building blocks
customer_reviews.text: These blocks helped a couple 5 and 6 year olds get through some Math laws study I gave them.
customer_reviews.author: Randy,

customer_reviews.title: ... old is learning fractions and she finds these very easy to understand
customer_reviews.text: My six year old is learning fractions and she finds these very easy to understand.

customer_reviews.title: Excellent learning tool!
customer_reviews.text: I recently purchased these fraction tower blocks. I teach in an elementary resource class and most of my students struggle with the concept of fractions. I have been using these blocks to illustrate equivalent fractions and comparing fractions and they work so great! I would recommend these to any teacher or parent working with students on fraction concepts.
customer_reviews.author: Chelsea Hosford

customer_reviews.title: math manipulatives fine enough
customer_reviews.text: There's nothing wrong with this product. Use it in tandem with a math lesson. Just be sure YOU know how to implement them in a lesson. If you're clueless just do a little research online so you can make it a fun learning activity and not confuse your child.
customer_reviews.author: BellaDK

customer_reviews.title: Bought these for my sons class and the teacher loves ...
customer_reviews.text: Bought these for my sons class and the teacher loves them. Loves the fact that fraction, decimal on different sides.
customer_reviews.author: spiritchild

customer_reviews.title: Great buy
customer_reviews.text: Great visual for teaching students fractions. Great in helping them to visualize equivalent fractions. Actually had a student say, "Now I get it!"
customer_reviews.author: Bette R

customer_reviews.title: This is a GREAT resource for our homeschooling
customer_reviews.text: This is a GREAT resource for our homeschooling. I like that it has the decimal, percentage and fraction sides. I highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Sharon E.

customer_reviews.title: Growing In Parts
customer_reviews.text: Gift for grand-daughter. Her mother is an ex-teacher. They seem very pleased with them.
customer_reviews.author: Engineer/Handyman

customer_reviews.title: Very nice
customer_reviews.text: Complements my granddaughter's preschool Montessori math lessons, but could be used for traditional math lessons for older kids. The set is well made and easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: Brad

customer_reviews.title: I love this Learning Resources Fraction Tower!
customer_reviews.text: I love this Learning Resources Fraction Tower! I got it for my 5 yr old doing 2nd grade math and it has helped him a lot in grasping the concept!
customer_reviews.author: Esse

customer_reviews.title: Helpful!
customer_reviews.text: Excited to see how these help! I think they will be an awesome teaching aide

customer_reviews.title: Very Cool!
customer_reviews.text: Very cool! Great way to teach kids (and adults) about the correlation between the metric and U.S. Systems of measurement.
customer_reviews.author: Delaware Mom

customer_reviews.title: This was a hit
customer_reviews.text: This is a great product. It is very simple to use but so developmental. The children love to be successful in building the totals with the blocks. It is a very tactile and visual learning tool.
customer_reviews.author: Walter106

customer_reviews.title: love it
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for blocks to help my kids with math and this set not only helped us with the colors and labels it made it very easy for my 7 year old to understand measurments .
customer_reviews.author: bianca santiago

customer_reviews.title: It's a toy - it's educational
customer_reviews.text: This is a wonderful product that teaches fractions (decimals and percentages) using unifix cubes. A child can easily see that 1/3 is bigger than 1/4.
customer_reviews.author: Skeeter

customer_reviews.title: Cleverly designed to show relationships between different ways of representing the same quantities
customer_reviews.text: This is a very clever designed aid for teaching fractions and decimals -- an amazingly simple but effective design. My 7 year old daughter who otherwise doesn't enjoy math loves math when it's tactile (she also loved Thinkfun Math Dice for the same reason).
customer_reviews.author: M. Arya

customer_reviews.title: These seem worth trying.
customer_reviews.text: These are colorful and appealing learning aids that I think will help my child.
customer_reviews.author: Adam Greenberg

customer_reviews.title: This is a great learning resource to help my child with learning fractions
customer_reviews.text: This is a great learning resource to help my child with learning fractions. Its a visual tool so the child can see physically what equals what.
customer_reviews.author: Alice Ceballos

customer_reviews.title: Useful for introducing fractions to students
customer_reviews.text: Great for tutoring elementary school kids as this is a great tool for teaching kids fractions! I also have the Hands-On-Standards: and they work great together!

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: The kids are thrilled with the visual and hands on assistace these provide

customer_reviews.text: I use these in my classroom. Kids love them and can't keep their hands off them.

customer_reviews.title: Fun Fraction Tower
customer_reviews.text: These were purchased to help my first grader and kindergartener with math. They love working with these; they help to make math fun. This product is sturdy. I plan to use it with my third child when she is old enough.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Daughter has learned easily, colors really help and the sizing is perfect to carry in my purse!
customer_reviews.author: EliEmi

customer_reviews.title: Great learning tool
customer_reviews.text: I bought this fraction cube tower set to use in our homeschooling lessons. My 10 year old son is trying to grasp fractions. This set - along with the Learning Resources Rainbow Fraction Circles - are great tools to help master fractions. We are just learning basic fractions at this time, but I can see where these cube towers will come in handy with decimals and percents later down the road (because they are marked accordingly on each side of the cube towers.)
customer_reviews.author: Mom21Son

customer_reviews.title: Wish the 1. 0 block was the same height ...
customer_reviews.text: Wish the 1.0 block was the same height as 10 unifix cubes though.

customer_reviews.text: I think this is a great visual learning aid Excited to see the response of my math Student Very good product

customer_reviews.title: Good buy!
customer_reviews.text: I tutor a variety of students and they were having trouble with fractions, decimals and percents. When these arrived i was so excited to see them and how colorful they are. I have used them with 2 of my students and i will continue to use them. Although, I wish that i could find more activities on how to use them and reproducible worksheets for the children using them.

customer_reviews.title: Works Great
customer_reviews.text: Bought for my 2nd Grader to help visualize math problems. It really has helped out. I'd recommend these products for sure.

She is 16 years old and we homeschool and I was struggling to teach her any kind of math concepts. We are breezing right through fractions with these. I only wish they had brailled them too.

customer_reviews.title: Great for hands-on and visual learners.
customer_reviews.text: As a former teacher, these are wonderful for showing how fractions relate to other fractions and to a whole. They are also a valuable tool in showing how fractions translate to decimals and percents.
customer_reviews.author: Betty T. Burnette

customer_reviews.title: Haven't used it yet, but I love it!
customer_reviews.text: My students are going to get so much out of these fraction blocks. I can't wait to hep make some connections with these manipulatives. They are a perfect size and they are easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica B.

customer_reviews.title: What we needed
customer_reviews.text: These fraction rods were delivered exactly as pictured. I really like that the fraction, percent, and decimal equivalent is on each rod. Perfect for my son who uses them to understand and master the concepts of fractions and percents.
customer_reviews.author: Jimmy

customer_reviews.title: Not great
customer_reviews.text: They don't fit together well. That's my main complaint. They also don't stand well so I probably have to buy the base.
customer_reviews.author: Sharon Chua

product_meta.title: Learning Resources Fraction Tower Activity Set, Math accessories, Teaching aids, 51 Pieces, Ages 6+
product_meta.description: Help young students learn math concepts such as decimals, percentages, and fractions with these durable, interlocking cubes. Children will learn by building simple, graphic mathematical models that clearly demonstrate fraction relationships. Cubes can be used alone or with Fraction Tower Activity sets.
feature_bullets: TEACH decimal, percentage, and fraction concepts in a hands-on, tangible way with these color-coded cubes
Great for visual learners these cubes feature fractions, decimals and percents clearly marked on each side.
All cubes are interchangeable, so, for example, you can make a whole with two ¼ cubes and one ½ cube.
Set includes 51 chunky, durable, color-coded cubes representing the whole, halves, thirds, quarters, fifths, sixths, eighths, tenths, and twelfths. Each cube is labeled on 3 sides.
